intro: Mammillaria elephantidens var. bumamma, commonly known as the Bumamma mammillaria, is a compact cactus native to Mexico. It features a short, cylindrical stem with dense clusters of white, radial spines and yellowish to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 centimeters and is characterized by its small, rounded tubercles. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun exposure, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Due to its slow growth and ornamental value, it is a popular choice among cactus enthusiasts.
